definition:
1. (Zo√∂l.)  A young goat. The . . . leopard shall lie down with the kid. Is. xi. 6 . 2. A young child or infant; hence, a simple person, easily imposed on. [Slang] Charles Reade. 3. A kind of leather made of the skin of the young goat, or of the skin of rats, etc. 4. pl.  Gloves made of kid. [Colloq. & Low] 5. A small wooden mess tub; -- a name given by sailors to one in which they receive their food. Cooper.

To bring forth a young goat.

A fagot; a bundle of heath and furze. [Prov. Eng.] Wright.

of Kythe. [Obs.] Gower. Chaucer.

See Kiddy, v. t. [Slang]
